Metrics¶

True/False Positive/Negatives¶

The methods to compute True/False Positive/Negative values should be implemented by the students. To this end, they receive the actual values y_true and predicted values y_pred, both as a numpy.array that are +1 for known values and -1 for anomalous values.

Assignment.TP(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → int¶

Computes the number of True Positives for given y_true and y_pred.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – True values corresponding to each prediction.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – Predicted values corresponding to each true value.

Returns

result – Number of True Positives.

Return type

int

Assignment.TN(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → int¶

Computes the number of True Negatives for given y_true and y_pred.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – True values corresponding to each prediction.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – Predicted values corresponding to each true value.

Returns

result – Number of True Negatives.

Return type

int

Assignment.FP(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → int¶

Computes the number of False Positives for given y_true and y_pred.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – True values corresponding to each prediction.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – Predicted values corresponding to each true value.

Returns

result – Number of False Positives.

Return type

int

Assignment.FN(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → int¶

Computes the number of False Negatives for given y_true and y_pred.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – True values corresponding to each prediction.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – Predicted values corresponding to each true value.

Returns

result – Number of False Negatives.

Return type

int

Test¶

To test the implementations of True/False Positive/Negative values, we provide test cases using the function test_metrics().

Assignment.test_metrics(verbose: bool = False) → None¶

Test whether the computed metrics are correct.

Metric implementations¶

Based on the student impelmentations, we compute the following metrics:

Assignment.TPR(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

True positive rate.

Assignment.TNR(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

True negative rate.

Assignment.FPR(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

False positive rate.

Assignment.FNR(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

False negative rate.

Assignment.accuracy(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Accuracy.

Assignment.precision(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Precision.

Assignment.recall(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

Recall.

Assignment.f1_score(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → float¶

F1-score.

Results¶

We provide functions to compute all metrics, and show them using show_report().

Assignment.prediction_report(y_true: numpy.ndarray, y_pred: numpy.ndarray) → None¶

Computes prediction metrics and prints them.

Parameters

  • y_true (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – True values corresponding to each prediction.

  • y_pred (np.ndarray of shape=(n_samples,)) – Predicted values corresponding to each true value.

Assignment.show_report(tpr: float, tnr: float, fpr: float, fnr: float, accuracy: float, precision: float, recall: float, f1_score: float) → None¶

Prints prediction report.

Parameters

  • tpr (float) – True Positive Rate to show.

  • tnr (float) – True Negative Rate to show.

  • fpr (float) – False Positive Rate to show.

  • fnr (float) – False Negative Rate to show.

  • accuracy (float) – Accuracy to show.

  • precision (float) – Precision to show.

  • recall (float) – Recall to show.

  • f1_score (float) – F1-score to show.
